head.title: Footlights; In Rock, Spelling Doesn't Count

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Music, Theater and Dance

hedline.hl1: Footlights; In Rock, Spelling Doesn't Count

abstract.p: Alternative rock groups featured during Y-100 Feztival at Blockbuster Sony Entertainment Center in Camden, NJ, noted (S)

block.p: The Y-100 Feztival, at 1:30 p.m. Wednesday at the Blockbuster Sony Entertainment Center in Camden, is as alternative as a radio-friendly music concert can get this summer. From the Stone Temple Pilots who serve up a grinding mix of coherent hard rock to the energetic ska-punk of Gwen Stefani's No Doubt, much of what the current modern rock format represents is showcased here.

The semi-charmed rock life of Third Eye Blind is propelled by pop punk that is more fresh and frenetic live than on their recordings. Stroke 9 are still enjoying the success of their sardonic guitar-pop mini-hit ''Little Black Backpack,'' from last year's ''Nasty Little Thoughts.'' Eve 6 plays its garage-styled brat-rock with intense glee and catchy refrains.

The Y-100 Feztival, at 1:30 p.m. Wednesday at the Blockbuster Sony Entertainment Center in Camden, is as alternative as a radio-friendly music concert can get this summer. From the Stone Temple Pilots who serve up a grinding mix of coherent hard rock to the energetic ska-punk of Gwen Stefani's No Doubt, much of what the current modern rock format represents is showcased here.

The semi-charmed rock life of Third Eye Blind is propelled by pop punk that is more fresh and frenetic live than on their recordings. Stroke 9 are still enjoying the success of their sardonic guitar-pop mini-hit ''Little Black Backpack,'' from last year's ''Nasty Little Thoughts.'' Eve 6 plays its garage-styled brat-rock with intense glee and catchy refrains.

The photogenic Lit also has an infectious hard-pop sound that was what made songs like the rousing ''Zip-Lock'' so successful (O.K., their ''Miserable'' video featuring Pamela Anderson Lee didn't hurt their career either).

For all-out creativity, the Violent Femmes are the prize. With roots imbedded in blues and folk, this eccentric band has influenced alternative rock for more than a decade. They are as current and unusual as ever.
